  • Constructor Details

    • TextualView

      public TextualView​(Mission mission, Window window)
      Constructor of the TextualView which contains the information of the mission. Associate with the window for adding itself to the window.
      Parameters:
      mission - the mission we want to add to the table.
      window - the instance window which contains the textualView

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      public void initialise()
      initalize the table area. Filling it with 'Nothing'.

    • setLockInstruction

      public void setLockInstruction​(boolean lockInstruction)
      Change the value for lockInstructions. For some actions, we want to make the ancient instructions conserved so need to set the lockInstruction true.
      Parameters:
      lockInstruction - the boolean value which marks if we need to conserve the ancient instruction or not.

    • setTextAreaText

      public void setTextAreaText​(java.lang.String s)
      Put a description in the textarea of the application.
      Parameters:
      s - the description we want to add.

    • getTextAreaText

      public java.lang.String getTextAreaText()
      Obtain the description on the textarea.
      Returns:
      the description on the textarea.

    • setTableSize

      public void setTableSize()
      Modify the size of the table according to the content of the table.

    • initiateRequestTable

      public void initiateRequestTable()
      Initialise the table with the mission loaded. ID,type,duration added for each pickup and delivery point. ID,type,departureTime added for depot point.

    • updateRequestTable

      public void updateRequestTable()
      Update the requestTable after calculating the tour. Change the order by the order of passing each point. DepartureTime and arrivalTime calculated for every point.

    • getColors

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> getColors​(int number)
      Obtain a random color
      Parameters:
      number - a number which helps to generate a color
      Returns:
      the arraylist of the color generated.

    • setColor

      public static void setColor​(javax.swing.JTable table, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> color)
      Set the color the table by using a list of the colors.
      Parameters:
      table - the table which we want to change the color.
      color - the list of the color we want to change.

    • getRequestTable

      public javax.swing.JTable getRequestTable()
      Obtain the requestTable in the window
      Returns:
      the requestTable in the window

    • getTextArea

      public javax.swing.JTextArea getTextArea()
      Obtain the textArea in the window.
      Returns:
      the textarea in the window.
